intro: Costus juruanus, commonly known as the Jurua Costus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers, and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking yellow and orange inflorescences that resemble spikes, typical of the genus Costus. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
